com.java.model.player

Class Player

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.java.model.Observable
      • com.java.model.player.Player

  • public class Player
extends Observable
    This class models the player, it holds the id, the name, and the order to play for the round robin.
    Version:
    2.0.0
    Author:
    Arnav Bhardwaj, Karan Dhingra, Ghalia Elkerdi, Sahil Singh Sodhi, Cristian Rodriguez

        Calculates the total number of armies to be given during reinforcement.
        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • getPotentialAttackScenarios

        public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String>> getPotentialAttackScenarios()
        All of the potential attack scenarios for current player.
        Returns:
        the comprehensive list with all source and target countries.

      • getActualMaxAllowedDiceCountForAction

        public int getActualMaxAllowedDiceCountForAction(java.lang.String action,
                                                 java.lang.String countryInScopeForAction,
                                                 int maxDiceCountAllowedForAction)
        Helper method to get max allowable dice count given specific context: action and country army count.
        Parameters:
        action: - either attack/defense.
        countryInScopeForAction: - either the source country to attack from / the target country to be attacked.
        maxDiceCountAllowedForAction: - a default max based on Risk game rules.
        Returns:
        selectedDiceCount: a valid number of dice to roll based on action and army counts.

      • fight

        public java.lang.Boolean fight(AttackPhaseState attackPhase)
        Main fight method which encompasses the dynamic interactions of rolling & comparing dice This handles the army count updates as well as conqueror id's if need be.
        Parameters:
        attackPhase -
        Returns:
        true if attacker conquers the target country

      • checkIfPlayerHasConqueredTheWorld

        public boolean checkIfPlayerHasConqueredTheWorld()
        Helper method to check if the player conquered the whole world.
        Returns:
        true if they conquered the entire world

      • fortify

        public void fortify()
        Method to guide the player through various fortification options when applicable.

      • getPotentialFortificationScenarios

        public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String>> getPotentialFortificationScenarios()
        Helper method to build a comprehensive map of all the possible fortification paths (for both immediate and extended neighbors) It has all the necessary checks and validation to ensure the path includes only countries owned by the given current player in the turn. Moreover, ensures that candidates suggested as "source countries" to move armies from satisfy the minimal requirements of army presence on the ground.
        Returns:
        Hashmap of all potential fortification scenarios for player.

      • buildFortificationPath

        public void buildFortificationPath(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String>> fortificationScenarios,
                                   java.lang.String rootCountry)
        Small helper method to ensure countries in scope are recursively traversed and included in the "path" This is NOT the final and full picture for fortification scenarios, it is merely a stepping stone. The main getPotentialFortificationScenarios method eliminates the invalid source candidates based on army counts
        Parameters:
        fortificationScenarios - a HashStructure to be populated
        rootCountry - country to be checked for adjacency

      • traverseNeighbouringCountries

        public void traverseNeighbouringCountries(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> longestConqueredPathFromRoot,
                                          java.lang.String rootCountry)
        Small helper method to recursively traverse all countries owned by player and build a steady path starting from the root country passed in.
        Parameters:
        longestConqueredPathFromRoot - to be drawn based on adjacency and country ownership
        rootCountry - country to serve as root of search
